pageContext.claim: “President Obama knew all about Russia in September just before the election and didn't do a thing about it because he thought that Hillary Clinton was going to win.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Obama made several attempts to stop Russia's election meddling in 2016, including speaking directly to Russian President Vladimir Putin in the fall of 2016. Just weeks before the election, the administration announced that Russia was behind the hacking of the Democratic National Committee. Meanwhile, during the campaign — or for months afterward — Trump repeatedly dismissed or belittled reports of Russian interference.
